data: 1 - No CPR, Supportive Care, No Intubation
2 - No CPR, Therapeutic Care, No Intubation
3 - No CPR, Acute Transfer, No Intubation
4 - No CPR, Critical Care, No Intubation
5 - No CPR,  Critical  Care, May Intubate
Code Status - Pediatric - Alternate Level of Intervention
q2h, for first 24 h post-op. If stable at 24 h, then q4h
q1h, for output and q2h for intake for first 12h, then q12h
To be off suction if drainage greater than 250 mL in 4 h
When continuous morphine infusion has been discontinued
qdaily, with half strength hydrogen peroxide solution
Therapy type: VAC,  75 mmHg, Pressure Interval: Continuous, Low Suction
Therapy type: VAC, 75 mmHg, Pressure Interval: Continuous, High Suction
Therapy type: VAC, 125 mmHg, Pressure Interval: Continuous, Low Suction
Therapy type: VAC, 125 mmHg, Pressure Interval: Continuous, High Suction

T;N, Bedrest with head of bed to maximum 40 degrees

T;N, Other (please specify), No hip flexion past 90 degrees
Nurse with minimal hip flexion and maximal knee flexion in bed (post spondylolistesis surgery)
Provider must order starting diet. RN or RD to place subsequent diet orders
Including IV Meds/Fluids, Including PO and Enteral  Meds/Fluids

Maintenance fluids: 75% total fluids are calculated as follows:
3 mL/kg/h for the first 10 kg
1.5 mL/kg/h for the second 10 kg
0.75 mL/kg/h for every kg above 20 kg
0.025 mg/kg, IV, q15min interval, PRN pain, drug form: inj
0.05 mg/kg, IV, q15min interval, PRN pain, drug form: inj
morphine PED ICU titratable infusion (200 mcg/mL) 2 to 6 kg in D5W
titrate, IV, 0 mcg/kg/h minimum rate, 20 mcg/kg/h maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate to achieve pain score of 0

titrate, IV, 0 mcg/kg/h minimum rate, 20 mcg/kg/h maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate to achieve pain score of 0

titrate, IV, 0 mcg/kg/h minimum rate, 20 mcg/kg/h maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate to achieve pain score of 0
15 mg/kg, PO, q4h interval, PRN pain-mild, drug form: oral liq

titrate, IV,  starting rate, 0 mcg/kg/h minimum rate, 200 mcg/kg/h maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate to achieve sedation score goals
midazolam PED ICU titratable infusion (5 mg/mL) 6 kg and above
titrate, IV,  starting rate, 0 mcg/kg/h minimum rate, 200 mcg/kg/h maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate to achieve sedation score goals
dexmedeTOMidine PED ICU titratable  infusion (4 mcg/mL) in NS
titrate, IV,  starting rate, 0 mcg/kg/h minimum rate, 1 mcg/kg/h maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate to achieve sedation score goals

For patients undergoing a two stage procedure, midazolam and dexmedeTOMidine have been shown to alter neuro vital signs that are used in the OR to assess spinal perfusion.
Discontinue both midazolam and dexmedeTOMidine 8 hours prior to second stage operation
proPOFol PED ICU continuous infusion (10 mg/mL)
For patients where fecal contamination is unlikely, order ceFAZolin

ceFAZolin can be safely administered to patients with penicillin allergy, including anaphylaxis. Do NOT administer if severe delayed skin reaction to any beta-lactam (e.g. drug reaction with eosinophilia and systemic symptoms, Stevens-Johnson syndrome, toxic epidermal necrolysis)
30 mg/kg, IV, q8h interval, hour, drug form: inj
For patients where fecal contamination may be possible, order gentamicin and ceFAZolin. If ceFAZolin allergic or contraindicated, order gentamicin
7 mg/kg, IV, q24h, hour, drug form: inj
DOPamine PED ICU titratable infusion (1.6 mg/mL)  2 to 6 kg in D5W
titrate, IV, 0 mcg/kg/min minimum rate, 10 mcg/kg/min maximum rate, titrate instructions: titrate to desired MAP
